name: Acute Idiopathic Corneal Hydrops
chief_complaint: Sudden blurry vision and eye pain in my left eye
physical_findings: Descemet's membrane folds visible on slit lamp
prognosis: Variable; most cases resolve spontaneously within weeks to months, but may leave residual corneal scarring
description: A sudden onset of corneal edema due to rupture of Descemet's membrane, typically occurring in patients with pre-existing keratoconus. The condition causes dramatic corneal thickening and vision impairment.
